content.raw: can this just be an `unsigned int`?
content.html: can this just be an unsigned int?

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw:
I actually wasn't sure what would be good here, so I just went with a string composed by the command description and the current time. This is generated by the client. But that might be a bad option. 

Which unsigned int do you think could work? Current time? How can we avoid collisions between different clients?
content.html:
I actually wasn't sure what would be good here, so I just went with a string composed by the command description and the current time. This is generated by the client. But that might be a bad option.

Which unsigned int do you think could work? Current time? How can we avoid collisions between different clients?

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: are the clients making use of this id? if not we could just generate this on the server side.
content.html: are the clients making use of this id? if not we could just generate this on the server side.

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: The id is how we know which command to jump to if the user selects it from the history.
content.html: The id is how we know which command to jump to if the user selects it from the history.

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw:
I see. Does this work?

1. client generates and sends `userCmd` without id

2. server receives `userCmd` and adds id 

3. server publishes `userCmd` stats with id's

4. client stores `userCmd` with id's that can be used for undo / redo

otherwise if it makes things easier and to avoid collisions between different client, we can generate uuid strings
content.html:
I see. Does this work?

  1. client generates and sends userCmd without id

  2. server receives userCmd and adds id

  3. server publishes userCmd stats with id's

  4. client stores userCmd with id's that can be used for undo / redo

otherwise if it makes things easier and to avoid collisions between different client, we can generate uuid strings

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: Oh that's true, the client only needs the id after it has received the stats from the server. So you'd use the wall time as uint?
content.html: Oh that's true, the client only needs the id after it has received the stats from the server. So you'd use the wall time as uint?

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: Oh also I should note that originally I was thinking of having a way to figure out which client the command came from, that's probably one of the reasons I'm generating the id in the client.
content.html: Oh also I should note that originally I was thinking of having a way to figure out which client the command came from, that's probably one of the reasons I'm generating the id in the client.

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: ah ok that makes sense, maybe we should just keep it as it is for now. Note that there still could be conflicts between ids for the corner case where two clients move the model at the exact same time
content.html: ah ok that makes sense, maybe we should just keep it as it is for now. Note that there still could be conflicts between ids for the corner case where two clients move the model at the exact same time

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: Since the strings use the same algorithm to generate ids, there is the possibility that the strings are not unique. Should we use uuid's instead?
content.html: Since the strings use the same algorithm to generate ids, there is the possibility that the strings are not unique. Should we use uuid's instead?

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: Sure, I'll use uuid instead
content.html: Sure, I'll use uuid instead

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.raw: I've been thinking more about this and it probably makes more sense to go with @iche033 's first suggestion of generating incremental unsigned int IDs on the server. If we need a way to identify clients later we can always add that to the message. Sounds good?
content.html: I've been thinking more about this and it probably makes more sense to go with @iche033 's first suggestion of generating incremental unsigned int IDs on the server. If we need a way to identify clients later we can always add that to the message. Sounds good?

pullrequest.title: Undo user motion commands during simulation

content.html:
How about using an embedded message instead, something like:

message UserCmdId
{
  Enum Type
  {
    SNAP = 1;
    TRANSLATE = 2;
    ...
  }

  required Type type;
  required string name;
}
